meanings.definition: A miserly person who hoards wealth and is reluctant to spend money.
meanings.sent1: The old man was known as a scrooge because he never shared his money.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a scrooge, share some of your candy with your friends.
meanings.sent3: The scrooge refused to buy a new coat even though his old one was falling apart.
meanings.sent4: Her boss was such a scrooge, he wouldn't even buy coffee for the office.
meanings.sent5: The scrooge's house was filled with treasures, but he never enjoyed them.

meanings.definition: To behave in a miserly or stingy manner.
meanings.sent1: She tends to scrooge when it comes to tipping at restaurants.
meanings.sent2: Please don't scrooge on buying gifts for your family during the holidays.
meanings.sent3: He decided to scrooge and only give his sister a small gift for her birthday.
meanings.sent4: The company had to scrooge on expenses to make a profit this quarter.
meanings.sent5: If you scrooge on quality, your customers will notice and go elsewhere.
